extendedIngredients.name: fresh basil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 tbsp fresh basil, finely chopped, plus more for serving, as desired
metaInformation: plus more for serving, as desired

extendedIngredients.name: fresh rosemary
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tsp fresh rosemary, removed from woody stems and minced

extendedIngredients.name: fresh thyme
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tsp fresh thyme, removed from woody stems and minced

extendedIngredients.name: kosher salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: kosher salt and freshly ground pepper, to taste

recipes.title: Pan-Roasted Trout with Tomatoes and Herbed Olive Oil

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir are my top picks for Fish. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Luna Nuda Pinot Grigio. It has 4.4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 14 dollars.

productMatches.title: Luna Nuda Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Light green lustres run through the radiant straw-yellow color of this wine, whose aroma is rich in fruits, the most striking of which are pears and apples. An excellent balance gives this wine strength and structure. It is dry and smooth on the palate with a pleasant, mineral aftertaste.

recipes.instructions: Make the herbed olive oil. Add the olive oil and herbs to a small mixing bowl and stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Set aside.Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add about a tablespoon of the olive oil to the skillet, just enough to coat the bottom, and heat until the oil begins to shimmer.Season the trout with salt and pepper and add skin-side up to the pan. Cook undisturbed until just golden, about 2-3 minutes. Flip the trout and transfer the skillet to the oven. Roast until the fish is opaque and cooked-through, about 5-7 minutes. Remove from the oven and serve warm with the fresh tomatoes and a drizzle of the herbed olive oil.

steps.step: Add the olive oil and herbs to a small mixing bowl and stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper, to taste. Set aside.Preheat the oven to 375 degrees.
Heat a large skillet over medium heat.

Add about a tablespoon of the olive oil to the skillet, just enough to coat the bottom, and heat until the oil begins to shimmer.Season the trout with salt and pepper and add skin-side up to the pan. Cook undisturbed until just golden, about 2-3 minutes. Flip the trout and transfer the skillet to the oven. Roast until the fish is opaque and cooked-through, about 5-7 minutes.
Remove from the oven and serve warm with the fresh tomatoes and a drizzle of the herbed olive oil.
